Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 12th overall pick, by Lynchburg in 1974...
Injured on 4/1/1975 with a Inflamed Hip Muscle, out for one week...
Had first career hit (double) on 5/11/1976, off Matt Corr (CI)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/22/1976, off Charlie Latson (CI)...
Injured on 6/9/1977 with a Inflamed Rib Cage Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 4/20/1981 with a Torn Groin Muscle, out for 4-5 weeks...
Signed as a free agent by Bay City on 2/16/1983 to a 3-year deal worth $1,560,000 per year...
Injured on 5/8/1984 with a Inflamed Hip Muscle, out for one week...
Won World Championship with Bay City in 1984...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Rightfield in 1984...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/12/1985, hitting .450 with 3 HR, 9 RBI...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Rightfield in 1985...
